encryption.crypter module¶

class encryption.crypter.Crypter(RNG)[source]¶

Bases: object

A utility that holds a user’s secret keys, handles the authentication handshake, encryption and decryption of messages, and garantees their integrity.

Parameters:RNG – A random function that’ll be used to generate keys. Must be cryptographically secure.
decrypt_key(encrypted_key)[source]¶

Decrypts a key.

Parameters:

encrypted_key – The secret key to decrypt.
Returns:

The decrypted key.
Raises:
  • NoKeyException – If the RSA key hasn’t been loaded yet.
  • CrypterException – If the loaded RSA key is public. It needs a private key to decrypt things.
decrypt_message(message)[source]¶

Decrypts the given message using the current AES key.

Parameters:message – The message to decrypt.
Returns:The decrypted message as a string.
Raises:CorruptedMessageException – The HMAC signature did not match the message or the message wasn’t the right size.
encrypt_key(raw_key)[source]¶

Encrypts a key.

Parameters:

raw_key – The secret key to encrypt.
Returns:

The encrypted key.
Raises:
  • NoKeyException – If the RSA key hasn’t been loaded yet.
  • CrypterException – If the loaded RSA key is private. It needs a public key to encrypt things.
encrypt_message(message)[source]¶

Encrypts the given message using the current AES key.

Parameters:message – The message to encrypt.
Returns:An encrypted message along with its HMAC and its initialization vector.
Raises:NoKeyException – If an AES key hasn’t been generated yet.
gen_and_set_aes_key()[source]¶

Generates and stores a 32 bytes AES key to encrypt messages with.

Returns:The generated 32 bytes AES key.
gen_and_set_rsa_key()[source]¶

Generates and stores a new RSA key pair.

gen_hmac(iv, encrypted_message)[source]¶

Generates 32 bytes of HMAC from a given initialization vector and encrypted message to ensure the message’s integrity.

Parameters:
  • iv – The initialization vector to generate the HMAC.
  • encrypted_message – The encrypted message to which the HMAC will be merged.
Returns:

The generated 32 bytes HMAC.
get_public_key_pem()[source]¶

Gets pem data for the public rsa key.

Returns:The pem data bytes.
Raises:CrypterException – If the current key type does not exist.
load_rsa_key(key_type, directory='keys')[source]¶

Loads an RSA key to perform handhsakes/authentication with.

Parameters:
  • key_type – keys.PUBLIC or keys.PRIVATE.
  • directory – The directory in which the key is stored.
Raises:
  • CrypterException – If the specified key_type does not exist.
  • NoKeyException – If there is no key file in the specified directory.
  • BackendException – If the serialized key is of a type that is not supported by the backend or if the key is encrypted with a symmetric cipher that is not supported by the backend.
set_public_key_from_pem(pem_data)[source]¶

Sets a new public key from pem data.

Parameters:pem data bytes. (The) –
sign(private_key, message)[source]¶

Signs a message with the private RSA key to authenticate it.

Parameters:
  • private_key – The secret key with which to sign the message.
  • message – The message to sign.
Returns:

The signature.
verify_signature(public_key, message, signature)[source]¶

Verifies the author’s identity for a given message.

Parameters:
  • public_key – The public key of the author.
  • message – The message to authenticate.
  • signature – The signature with which the author signed the message.
  • private_key – The secret key with which to sign the message.
  • message – The message to sign.
Raises:

InvalidSignature – If the signature does not match the public key.
